f8M4PuxkM29iP6ltNclWmg.text: Only reason why it's four stars for me is because the seating is one table with a U-shaped bench that you'd have to share with strangers if you wanted to sit down and have food there. Otherwise, the portions are ridiculously gigantic. A medium is TWO POTATOES! One is more than enough. My friend got the small potato with sweet corn and I got a small potato with the avocado salad. Everything was fresh and simple yet done so well with such flavor! I also do appreciate that they have plenty of vegan and vegetarian options. Great service and atmosphere - we plan on going there a few more times during our stay in Edinburgh.

5-OrGWv4ib28AiUR1MjlCQ.text: That. Won't. Fit.  My reaction when opening up my hot baked potato at home (it's only a small walk so it was pipin' hot too!)  What can I say that hasn't been said before? I got one with cheese, and if I have one comment it is this: that, my friend, is not a topping. That, is stuffing. I could swear I heard the potato squeel when the friendly boy was ramming the cheese into that poor potato.  Back at home the cheese had become all melty and gooy and my face was one big potato-y mess. But oh man ohmanohman, was I happy.  Joy.  Value for money? Absolutely. Foodcoma? Garantueed.

FaV6IcrBsPbLNqQ6R-VPdg.text: A popular one with the tourists (as the rave reviews suggest), I guess the Baked Potato Shop is seen as somewhat of a novelty to people visiting Edinburgh for the first time.  It serves up fresh and hearty baked potatoes (no, really?) for a reasonable enough price - although it has the traditional, additional Cockburn St tax. So if you're stopping by for a bit of a stodgy meal, be prepared to empty your wallet of an extra couple of pounds!  Saying that, the portions are generous and well made so you don't begrudge paying the extra money. Cockburn St is a nice location to grab some food, and if it's a nice day you can always sit out on the Royal Mile to savour the fresh air as well as lunch.  It's always packed and it's vegetarian friendly. There are a ton of other pubs and diners in the area which serve up similar potato options, but the homely exterior, great cooking and good service of the Baked Potato Shop keeps the customers coming through the door in their flocks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

FFnXz5cutj6OLsbXB5LrqQ.text: Perfect place for vegetarians. I enjoyed Cheddar and Haggis toppings. Only seating for 6.

ijJtY6i9dJogFAll63_dqg.text: I freaking love the baked potato shop.   If your a tourist come here just to get cheap and filling food, and if your not just come here because the baked potatoes are BOMB!!!! During the festival in the summer this place is ALWAYS PACKED!!!  My favourite is the baked potato with curry and Greek salad. I cannot count the amount of time I have come here hung-over/still drunk and have not been disappointed! GOD I FRIGGIN LOVE THIS PLACE. Just a couple of months ago I was showing some friends around Edinburgh. They all demanded to stop at the subway near this place but I knew this place was better and then I had to hear them bitch for and hour about how I got more food for less money! HAHAH SUCKA'S!!!  ****** but seriously....LOVE IT***************

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. MMMMm... AMAZING!

1Ryk5ILq2cDHP5vGkSeOPA.text: I've never seen and eaten such a big potato like this:)   You can choose topping and size and there're many side dishes.   In my case I could eat big size for lunch and dinner! I really stuffed myself:D   I recommened this to my friends who went to edinburgh. When I go to glasgow next time, I'll drop by there:p   You should go there and try:)))@

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

LyZfmPhn9Ycx_FV78W4qQw.text: This place was a quaint little shop in the middle of Old Town Edinburgh.  The only interesting thing about it was that it was vegetarian! I've never had a baked potato without bacon.  However, this was listed on the yelp posting, so I cannot complain! It was deliciously vegetarian and the portions were very generous.  I think that they could have had a bit more hot topping options, but other than that it was delicious, cheap, and quick.

TkAxD9bLAoaCz9RBLEVXxw.text: 'Aaah, so this is the Baked Potato Shop that is so highly recommended on Yelp', I found myself wondering as I turned onto Cockburn street and entered the shop.  Firstly, the smell of the shop is worth one star alone - the delicious smell of baking potatoes is simply mouthwatering, and thats just a prelude to how the potatoes taste.Soft, crispy skinned and delicious. Lots of toppings/fillings to choose from  - certainly some odd ones, but generally all amazing.   Prices are decent for Cockburn Street, and staff are great. Gets a little busy, but with a smell like that drawing people in, its understandable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hxqbyBI9ASl_yGffWEAw1g.text: Wandered in here randomly when we were hungry and tired of spending too much eating out while toursiting in Edinburgh. The potatoes and toppings were delicious and the value for your money was ridiculous. They offer small, medium and large which are not just different size of potatoes, but actually whether you get 1, 2 or 3 whole potatoes. The toppings varied from cheese to curried corn to almost anything in between. We also walked out with two mediums (i.e., 4 potatoes) for less than 5 pounds. It's really hard to argue with that.

4mJZVVWK2xzqPYFQ7CWuWg.text: OK, so I went to the Baked Potato Shop and didn't order a baked tattie, but I'm contrary like that, sometimes (most of the time). Their Bombay potato soup and mixed veggie roll were both excellent, though, so I'd recommend this as a good place for a tasty, health, good value lunch.  Overall, we said: "the food from the Baked Potato Shop was first class, and the lunchtime deal represented good value. I'll certainly head back there again, and maybe this time I'll go for one of their famous baked tatties. Now if I could just convince them to dispense with microwaving the soup..."

bUMXxt43cFhCrbo20HyDAA.text: I took my mother here when she visited me at the beginning of the festival. There is one table and every time I have passed by there have been people at it. Our visit was no exception. We ended up sitting in the park at the bottom of the hill, which was very nice, but possibly not so great when it's not summer.  The food itself is great. My first job as a school kid was in a baked potato shop, so I have a nostalgic affection for the baked potato as a meal. These guys didn't disappoint.  They were getting smashed me when went in, but the guy who served us was friendly and efficient. And as helpful as we needed him to be.  We ordered the medium size. I was planning on ordering the large as we had been walking around town all day and I generally have a big appetite anyway. But ended up opting for medium. It was perfect. Verging on too much, but that was what I was after. My mother couldn't quite make it to the end, but enjoyed it also.  Their is a good combination of toppings, everything looks fresh and there are a decent selection of treats and drinks.

f7j3G101am2pxfUGiwevxQ.text: I stopped in here on a trip to scotland in May. What a great little find. The potatoes were awesome and the gentleman working that day was wonderful. Definitely worth a pop in if you're in the area.

2Fq4nB5R_cC91re3m_ISCA.text: Delicious and filling meal at a low price. Located on a side-street just off the Royal Mile  it's a perfect location for those sight-seeing or visiting for a festival, etc.  Vast variety of fillings, all vegetarian, and all delicious! I had spicy hummus with a few extras and it was a huge portion and very filling. Nice range of vegan and vege friendly cakes also on offer.  As others have mentioned, as it is a small shop, there isn't a great deal of sitting space but given its close proximity to Princes Street Gardens, I find it quite pleasant to walk downhill and eat my food there. Unfortunately if the weather is bad you might not have many options  which is why it has lost a star.  Food is a 5 though, well worth a visit

pv1hozjB94ScnltNHwQZtQ.text: As another Yelper said, you don't get a topping, you get a filling. I got a small with cheddar and sweetcorn, and was overwhelmed (in a good way) with just how much they stuff that sucker with. (Good combo too, incidentally... love the sharpness of the cheddar combined with the sweetness of the corn and fluffiness/crispyness of the potato). This was meant to be a snack, but easily turned into an actual meal, all for under 4 quid. Very happy with the shop, a great place for anyone on a budget.

y9nRtKbqNJaLRQS6BN46-Q.text: The Baked Potato Shop really does have the best baked potatoes ever.  No joke, ever.  It was an amazing find when I was a student because I could make two meals out of the BP, easy.  They're huge!  (admittedly, I eat a lot more now, so it's just one meal for me these days)  As far as I am aware they only have veggie toppings.  I'm a meat eater but have no problem with veggie food and when it comes to a BP even prefer the veggie stuff.    Every time I eat here I choose the three bean topping with cheese.  The beans are cold, unfortunately, which means that the cheese doesn't melt, but it doesn't even matter; the taste is phemonenal.    My only gripe is that they have space for about two people to sit in which means that every time I've been here I've had to find a place to sit and eat my meal somewhere around the Mile.  That is fine in nice weather, but we're in Scotland here, and nice weather doesn't come around that often.    But, they work with what they have and do a fantastic job of it.  I'll definitely be coming here next time I have a few after work pints in that region, because I am craving a baked potato now.

ObXciFHZwj_4THssf3QgCw.text: great place in the town center clockwork concept, potato with filling, really like the place, very friendly and cheerful staff.  Prices are resonably.  place for four people to sit in the place

0Zzi0V0VihK-jGL1bIp8-A.text: I LOVE their desserts.  They have the caramel shortbread.  I'm american, and to me.. it tasted like Reeses Pieces, less crumbly, more caramely, slightly less sweet. And the guy recommended their Tiffin, which he described as "Christmas pudding- almost."  And I tried Xmas pudding awhile back.. it's good, like fruitcake soaked in rum.  I came back and bought a kilo of this stuff to take home.  It's that yummy.

7O8jGJqrnvvk7_fqlvT46Q.text: Hottest Tattie in Town?  If the queues outside the Baked Potato Shop are anything to go by, I don't think I'm the only one that agrees with the shop's sign. The secret of their success is generously portioned potatoes that are crispy on the outside and gorgeously warm and mushy inside. The toppings are pretty impressive too with a staggering range of veggie and vegan options from humous, peppers and avacado to veggie chilli, veggie curry, beans and cheese, coleslaw and cheese, tuna and sour cream.  The only thing they could do to improve things is stay open later and introduce a seating area upstairs or outside. As it is, it's a case of finding a dry, clean bench or step somewhere nearby.

SRU8og0NEqQYqFQNYGl5zw.text: Wow I love this place!  There isn't much seating but the food is fab!  Definitely try the vegetarian haggis if they have it.  Big portions and fair prices!  Great as a touristy stop for food.  Try it!

O-sTEPHCwwxi4SvYZFditg.text: What a great idea....a baked potato with tons of options for stuff on top. I had the vegan haggis and it was very tasty. I would give it 5 stars if it had more seating. Inexpensive and many options for vegans. Yeah!

VUthMSwPgYuoLMdmfcKkAA.text: Way overrated. Thanks a lot BuzzFeed!! We had the avocado salad (pretty much a guacomole with cubed cheese and sliced tomatoes) and the vegetarian curry (everything is vegetarian or vegan there). The curry had zero flavor. The most bland curry of my life. The avocado salad was alright because everyone loves avocados, but the cheese wasn't great, and there were hardly any tomatoes. It's just a bunch of avocado, which is already bland, smeared on top of a bland baked potato. Seating isn't great here, can probably only seat 4-5 people at a time. Don't waste your time and meals here.

7BB20r1RsizrSF6uNoIc9A.text: Good take away, tasted delicious. A bit pricey, but worth it.  I found it kinda hard to eat the potato because there was no space left anywhere in the tray.

7SeTjLfwBH9hC03rafcIDg.text: Oh, it pains me to give 2 stars. It's very rare. My one experience here was 2 stars, but as a disclaimer, if I came back and knew what to order and what to stay away from, it could go higher.   I was so excited to see a shop right next to where I was staying in Edinburgh on the Royal Mile with vegan options! This shop is all vegan and vegetarian, which is so cool, and still fairly rare in the UK.   I ordered a small baked potato (the other reviewers are right, a small one is definitely big enough for 2 meals!) and after much consideration, got it topped with baked beans and with avocado. Everything on the menu that is vegan is labeled V for vegan, and apparently they even have vegan butter.   I was starving, so also ordered a packet of crisps and a slice of chocolate cake. (Sometimes after a gal is done climbing Arthur's Seat, she's just gotta carbo-load, ya know?)  When I got back to the flat I was staying in, I excitedly opened my huge and messy baked potato, starving and ready to demolish it. with my hungry girl appetite. I noticed the avocado wasn't actually avocado, but guacamole. That's ok; I wouldn't have ordered guacamole and baked beans, but I was willing to try it. When in Edinburgh, after all. After a few bites, I noticed the guacamole had something else in it. Cheese.   Wah-Wah.  Who puts cheese in guacamole? I get that might be a thing, and some people might like loads of cheese cubes in your avocado dip; hey whatever floats your boat. But at a cafe that caters to vegans and knows what a vegan is, I think it's strange and disappointing to put cheese in a dish that traditionally doesn't call for it. And I hadn't thought to ask if the avocado was vegan, because duh, it's a fruit. I didn't know that avocado meant guacamole, and that their guacamole would have cheese in it. I did ask if the butter was vegan, which I would have super appreciated if the word vegan would have tipped off the gal making my potato.   So I moved on my to my cake. Which tasted like vegan cake from 1977. Very dry and crumbly, not sweet.   But, the server was very nice, and there were lots of options to choose from. If you go and you're vegan, just make sure you ask lots of questions and read the menu carefully.   And now I'm going to move my review up to 3 stars because I'm happy there's a vegan option close in Edinburgh and even though my food didn't work for me, I would try again if I were in the neighborhood/city/country again. And because they were nice.

V1d-HpmdxKvDzyC3QGUR5g.text: Been here twice during my visits. Hits the spot on those cold and wet Scotland days.

VAK6Dq5uC4tf13N_nE1cVA.text: Mmm, baked potatoes. For the carbohydrate aficionado in all of us, this shop is a perfect way to get a do-it-yourself meal just off of the Royal Mile. I want one back at home!  You can choose from a variety of toppings, including a slew of vegetarian and vegan options, which is great. The small potato with cheese I ordered was actually two potatoes that were literally covered in cheddar-y goodness. Very messy, very hot, and very good. The toppings may look like too much at first, but there is enough to last through the whole thing and never leave any bare potato. Once you reach the skin, if you still have any room left in your stomach, eat the skin. It is delicious.   If you can, upon receiving your warm and crispy potato, find a place to sit (Scottish weather permitting), and enjoy people-watching while stuffing your face.

sa8qzEP8nQlx1HdCc-g71Q.text: If I decided to search out a religion and give up my atheist ways, I'm certain the Baked Potato Shop would be my church and the food inside my god.  I have never seen anything like this place anywhere on Earth. My meal of towering vegan haggis, baked beans and fresh spinach salad on top of a mammoth serving of piping hot potato was truly a spiritual experience. I was so devoutly affected, I almost prayed.  Amen.

CAhb4BbhdzV6V1DJFz-7nA.text: Big portions. My husband and I split a small potato with beansand cheddar cheese. Great place and food prices.

RwT2l89DhN2VeCuaj7x9-Q.text: If small is so big, I know want to know what medium or large look like!  This was the first place I came to when I moved to Edinburgh, I had been looking at reviews and was determined to find the vegetarian side of the city. The baked potato shop was very high up the list of recommended places.  It is small inside, there is very little room, but on offer are many options for vegetarians and vegans. They do some fantastic vegan cakes, samosas, soups, and of course, baked potatoes.   I ordered small with haggis and baked beans. It was humongous! This was my first experience of haggis, and though I can't say I'm a fan, I'm glad I got the opportunity to try it. The potato was cooked to perfection and considering the size, it was great value.  This is a really conveniently located little place for tourists, students and businessmen alike, just off the royal mile, near St Giles cathedral, the castle and Waverly station. If you need comfort food (and you will during the Scottish winter, believe me), do try this place out.

LAXqIwzxsT3DW8aIz69Klw.text: I can't believe I forgot to review the Baked Potato Shop immediately after my trip to Edinburgh, because honestly, this was pretty much the best place I ate in all of Scotland. Let me clarify: I LOVE potatoes, and most people/restaurants in the US don't have any appreciation for potatoes (much less understand the concept of jacket potatoes) unless they come as french fries.  But, really, baked potatoes are my favorite thing.  So, naturally, I got a medium potato with some kind of greek salad, cheese and avocado, and it was fantastic. I only wish I could eat here everyday.

1SsexNX9qgUZjM80Q7IVIQ.text: I actually did not get a baked potato--I got the samosa and a mango kiwi cake. The samosa was really good--perfectly cooked and full of flavor. However, the mango kiwi cake was quite different. The cake did not taste like anything nor did the frosting except where a piece of kiwi had been sitting on the frosting--It was very moist though!  Be warned, there is only one booth.

eMK-0JWddL5a5O6UcOwMVQ.text: If you are vegan and love hearty potatoes, you NEED TO head here. Enjoyed our second time dining here in ten years - I could eat one of their vegan potatoes every day. Great options for fillings. Go now.

-jCm1GycoyLASf3LzEbN0Q.text: I wish I took a picture of my potato because it was truly amazing! I went in here hungry and immediately thought I would get a large potato, but the small potato was GIGANTIC! I ended up getting the small potato....but it was SO GOOD! 100 thumbs up

9OrscFZuB_i42eiiLPzKPA.text: Cockburn Street's Baked Potato Shop is the stuff of legend.   Baked potatoes for around the 3-4 mark are exceptionally good value for money, especially for its location in the city centre.   The staff are friendly and cheerful on the whole.   There are only two slight problems I have ever had with the shop, one is the music can be a bit 'niche' (but I've only ever had takeaway so haven't had to endure it for any length of time) and the other is that, if, like me, you're an omnivore, you're out of luck on the bacon front as they're a vegetarian and vegan outfit. That said the spuds are great with crispy skins and great fillings.   Good, honest, filling, inexpensive.

c2SgIxtCJheXSfc5i3Et4g.text: I just couldn't bring myself to walk far from my hotel on the mile, but also couldn't bring myself to eat another expensive gastropub meal. I got a potato with the avocado salad- which had delicious surprise giant chunks of cheese in it. So happy with my decision. Warning, the medium loaded with one salad weighs as much as a baby. Small is more than sufficient for a meal for someone who isn't starving. Although the medium leaves me half a potato for breakfast...

xXf3C6P_hB-TmoXjo5fI3A.text: The most non - tasty baked potato I've ever had. There was no salt, no butter, no olive oil, no nothing. I had the mushroom with sour cream filling and it had as little sour cream in it as you can imagine. No good.

X2H2g6hYLoy-6H70GWpFLQ.text: A great place to stop, we had two baked potato boxes and two slices of the vegan cake (mango and carrot). The fillings were excellent, between us trying the humous, baked beans, vegan haggis (a mix of nuts and seeds with a texture very similar to haggis and very good) and veggie curry. The portions are huge however so watch out! I would definitely recommend the cake but maybe go for a salad box next time as the baked potato wasn't really needed. Would rather just have a box of fillings

L42EEGgois05f4ywVqFqcQ.text: Nom nom nom.  PO-TA-TO!  As mentioned by others, bugger all seating but craploads of potatos and yumbo fillings. I got the chili with avo and it was fab!  As mentioned by Jenny (and I only noticed AFTER I had ordered my medium potato), a medium potato is two potatoes. This fat bastard was not fat enough to get through all of them twos so I didn't get to eat the skin :( :( If you can get through the large with fillings then you truly are a Fat Bastard (tm) and I congratulate you fine sir or madam.  Only thing better than the potatoes was the music playing during potato construction including hits such as "Jesus loves you". Was very awesomesauce.

k9WJC0BC9Y9iJG3Vu7JAUw.text: This is the best baked potato shop!!! Now I'm a tall guy and need my food to get through the day and I have had plenty experiences of baked new potatoes around the city. Here, no such thing, I can even imagine that one would have to beg them to use one potato. And I like the healthy fillings rather then the 10 fillings all swimming for their flavour life in mayonnaise or dry chicken option. All options are vegetarian or vegan and I like my meat but these mixtures are all making that thought not important at all. I can't decide my favourite which is great for both sides as I'll walk any hill and cross any screeching amateur bag piper to get to this cosy potato shop again.    "I think the pipers would make more money if they rather stopped then playing when given money"

xnFFepgD_zalXYS4ol59nw.text: This is one of those of times where something is obvious, brilliant, and novel all at the same time. When it makes so much sense, so clearly meant to be, that you can't believe it's somehow happening to you for the first time. Where are all the baked potato shoppes of the world, with their steaming jackets of soft, buttery, salt-studded potato filled with the sumptuousness fillings of your choice-- creamy mushrooms?? Egg salad?? Curried tuna??   Gooey melting cheddar and sour cream is what I ended up with, but I could have gone back every day to sample all of their comfort food offerings. Except maybe the vegetarian haggis---I don't need to try that one ; )  The medium potato was SO big and SO filling, I'd like to see Michael Phelps finish one on his own! And yet as my body started to feel like it was morphing into an actual stuffed potato , I couldn't stop forking more of that salty, gooey yumminess into my mouth. The skin! the melted cheese! The love of pure, unadulterated carbohydrates! And for three pounds.   Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes, Yes.   Such a simple, sustainable food that has been the poor man's supper for thousands of years still brings so much comfort and pleasure, that  it makes you stop and ponder all those expensive nights out at posh, elitist fusion restaurants.   Long live the potato shop! Please expand to the United States!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

df9g4d3OdmqGATPbG4VCVA.text: As a tourist visiting Edinburgh for 48 hours, this stop was a must for my roommate and I. I've never seen an entire shop dedicated to baked potatoes in the States and it did not disappoint in the slightest. They are very vegan friendly too! I had the chili on mine and my friend got the curry. We both loved our meals and had a bit leftover even. The shop is TINY and we shared the one table with two other people but it added to the charm ad everyone was nice. I dream of going back someday.

PhMv2HxhJ-0h289gmpSTxQ.text: Ok, the perfect vegetarian potato experience right in the centre of town. Has around 30 combinations of potatoes, greek salad, avacado salad, cheese, baked bean, haggis, pineapple, curried spinach, mexican bean, pasta, homous sweet and sour. I could go on and on (until there's 30). They have a wide range of sweets, drinks and cakes, not to mention soup for those Scottish winters days. The staff get to chose the music which ranges from Pantara to SClub7! Best thing they are open late, though mind the homeless folk who go in to steal drinks from the fridges, usually late when there's a shift change. Amazing cheap and healthy food folks - yummy!

4GJYYeTOoB3A9aOH4Dd9tw.text: I found the prices quite expensive here. Quite a large selection of fillings to choose from and the smell when you walk past the shop is lovely and makes you so hungry. Always served quickly. Need more tables to sit at though.

L9tMpkD-N64yny0isid9BA.text: I always go for baked potatoes with pineapple, onion and cheddar. just yummy

i4Dkm3rK12nL2CkdDe7Khg.text: The choice is incredible and the taste is even better! The staff are quite friendly but they should get some more table in. Prices are reasonable and worth it!

OMY71NZn5Rqf5uBOkxG9Jw.text: busy busy busy, don't go for a quick lunchtime snack, the queue is usually onto the mile after noon, especially in the festival! however the entire menu is vegetarian with some vegan options thrown in for good measure, the staff are patient and friendly and you can choose to have salad boxes or pakora/samosa's if you cant stomach another potato. you must try the cakes..mmmmmm cake...

aZcZsoZoMAbAnJs6M6Zj9A.text: Even for carnivores like me The Baked Potato Shop on Cockburn Street is a firm favorite. During my days at college I would eat a large potato (which normally come with a warning from the staff of "they're pretty big) on the way home and it would hold my hunger until at least the following morning.  It's a tiny little shop - you can probably only fit a handful of people in the shop at any one time - so in the month of August the queue normally starts out the door but the portion sizes normally increase with it a large potato becomes a meal for two or maybe even three!  I love a classic cheese potato but there are a number of other veggie options. I can only imagine the guac is made fresh every day as it is always on point.  The only downside is there is nowhere to sit an eat. They only have one table with a corner bench that fits around four people. I don't mind sitting next to people I don't know but when you are with a couple of friends you might not be able to eat in the shop - which is never great in a Scottish November.

k2LlCb8PHQJes8L6UKpVUA.text: Love the concept and had to try this out. I bought a small baked potato with 2 fillings and it was enough to fill me up for lunch. My two fillings were the chili and the mexican, and I loved them both! Beware it's a tiny shop with only enough seating for 3-4 people, so if you plan on eating here I'd recommend getting your food to go.

_NJQuq051KC36bX4eGw08w.text: The portion is huge and great price if you're hungry. The toppings could be a little more flavorful.

qHp_WgYOGDT298vlMvW-_A.text: Nothing too special. It's not even that cheap too considering the costs of the ingredients. However, the egg, cheese, and mayo potato that I had was pretty good! Everything was fresh and the service was fast.

lrvy8oTH7Txd7NplFNhiZA.text: Okay okay baked potatoes! Served hot with some varieties of cold and hot fillings! The place is best for takeaways!

3Mlwa3FwKUl0GOeU3HukvQ.text: Big bake potatoes with lots of topping options. Including a bunch of vegan ones. I definitely recommend the couscous and chili for a vegan option. Only draw back is that they only have one small table inside so we had to stand outside in the cold while eating our potatoes

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan Toping Options

nKGGLVgOJkRcEFJNpvvOog.text: This place is brilliant!  It's a tiny hole in the wall restaurant with a hipster staff and decor, but the food is no nonsense, fresh and tasty. Prices are perfect, ingredients are fresh, and service is friendly. What more could you ask for?  We shared a single, large cheese and onion potato and it was heavenly. I'm not saying this is gourmet food, and nobody is going to be photographing it for their next cookbook, but if you like baked potatoes, then you're going to get what you want.  There are plenty of tourist traps and overpriced pubs in the neighbourhood. If you want somewhere to spend some time and have a beer, then those may be for you. But if you're budget conscious and simply want tasty food, then the Baked Potato Shop is a must.  Highly recommended.

f2B_x4HUnVu0ZLCM5x6OFA.text: Had a potato jacket with the cheese/pineapple/onion mix, which was hearty and delicious. But, what brought us back for a second visit in a 2 day span was the Caramel Shortcake. It was amazing and only 0.99!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Potato jacket with cheese / pineapple / onion. So tasty!
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Caramel Shortcake = nom nom nom!

tqQXdy0YDhgEEEAFE2u_2w.text: It's been 9 years and I still fantasize about this shop. Best baked potato ever. It was so damn good. Excellent service, which is obvious if 9 years later they are still on my mind.

XVzFEViZfAfgT4w-_6n7vg.text: The Baked Potato Shop takeaway is one of the best, if not, the top-of-his-class, vegetarian-vegan baked potato shop based in the heart of Edinburgh Old Town. Ordered a massive potato with a touch of butter and two vegetarian fillings: egg and mayo plus avocado salad, both were made from scratch and super fresh. All very healthy and pleasantly tasty. ( 5.20) The server behind the counter was a very friendly and efficient Spanish bloke. Bear in mind that the premises are small, with only one small rectangular table that can squeeze/accommodate four people tops, depending on your BMI.  As it's a very popular shop, expect a small queue as the place is steadily busy. This was not my first time and won't be my last one either!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Xfw201dnfoo94gj0wKemkg.text: Erm. It's the Baked Potato Shop. An Edinburgh institution! It does baked potatoes and they are absolutely amaaaazing. They only do veggie and vegan fillings, which means a rainbow assortment of toppings for your tattie, and they do not scrimp on size.  The tatties provided are monster portions, so be aware of this when ordering. I remember I once saw a family of Spanish tourists order four large servings - they could have had one between the family! They were swimming in baked potatoes.   One small baked potato with one filling is all you need to feel full as you like. There is one tiny table to sit in with - the place does well for tourists and folk on the go.   Love, love, love the Baked Potato Shop!

-RBXfK5lNlTedvXdyiYbng.text: I ventured here after a long walk up to the top of Arthur's Seat and then was heading to the Castle via foot on the hunt for food. A friend who was visiting said he felt like a baked potato, so we ventured to the Baked Potato Shop as I had remembered passing it before and thought it smelled amazing.  Now, it was a gray-sort of slightly-cold day and I in my American-ness was thinking baked potato with broccoli and cheese sounds amazing, but low-and-behold, they don't actually offer many hot toppings for your hot potato. If my memory serves me correctly, it had maybe 5 or 6. The obvious baked beans or chili were options and while both sounded good, they weren't anything too out there.  It was new to me to put chilled sort of salads/mixes on top of a warm potato, but they all looked quite tasty and delicious and extremely fresh so I thought I would try the 'Mexican' topping of kidney beans, corn and peppers atop my potato. I ordered the smallest one and had to say it was a bit pricy for a potato, almost 5 pounds for a small, and in my mind, potatoes are dirt cheap...  Anyways, I am SO glad I opted for the small. Despite my ravenous, long-walk induced appetite, it was entirely too massive. It would have been nice to have one slightly smaller, that was slightly cheaper. Although tasty, it didn't really strike me as a great and absolutely essential food buy for the money I spent on it.  They do have a large array of options and think they have lots of vegan options, all healthy, so that is nice for anyone looking to carb load via vegetarian.   They weren't busy and the service was friendly, but a bit slow. The other friend we were  with just got cheese and most of it wasn't melted, so it was just a giant pile of grated cheese and didn't really meet his expectations. They do put butter on the hot potato if you would like, which is nice, otherwise it might be a bit dry as most of the toppings don't have a sauce...think, veggie salsa or salad on top.  My boyfriend had the chili, which was pretty good, so if I ever go again I think I would opt for the comfort of some chili and cheese on a massive potato. They are also cash only so make sure you've got some on hand. There also is only one small table inside, maybe big enough for 4 max, so it is best to take-away and eat somewhere near by off the Royal Mile. Although, a potato is not really a summer crave when sitting in the park, this is certainly a winter-warm type destination in my mind.

IvqxJlaKjZvtwMceZ1Imdg.text: One of my favorite stops for lunch or dinner while in Edinburgh. Great price and large portions. Never a disappointment.

s3vUjTNRDYzk9xG9q3D5iw.text: I travel to Edinburgh for business quite often, and this is my go to dinner spot. Actually, if they are open, i wouldn't even consider any other spot! Their potatoes are perfectly steamed and toped with whatever you choose, ALL VEGETARIAN! My favorite was the black bean and corn salsa mix, cheese, and salt and pepper. So delicious!

qmjJu4r82CZt9V4pEIHFdQ.text: Wonderful filling lunch or snack.  Inexpensive potatoes with tons of great toppings/filling, and love that they heap tons of cheese on the potatoes.  Veggie Haggis was suprinsgly tasty.  Only downside is not much room for seating.  Owners are super nice!

1D-PoK8JnoAL5Pfce43GRQ.text: Right after eating Oink I came to the Baked Potato Shop and split a small baked potato with my friend. This was such a good meal in colder weather. I had the chili, corn, and cheese topping and it was so delicious. I don't know how they do it but the potato on the inside were so soft and broke apart like a baked Yam. The small potato is a full meal for a grown adult. I would come back for more.

D8MWjguKciw5ypuDFL3DpQ.text: I loved our visit to The Baked Potato Shop!  Not only did I get a huge baked potato meal, but, got to have it just the way I wanted it. We actually ended up sitting at a table with a young woman from United States who was studying at Edinburgh Uni. Great place to drop in and enjoy a good meal.

b3ySrkG0GAO_PR5-pyziDg.text: I had the small potato with mushroom and sour cream, because they were out of avocado salad, the topping wasn't really overwhelming good, but I probably made a poor choice, the people around me had beans and cheddar cheese and looked really good.

lmTorZaEL2xXdbKrPYL4_A.text: I seem to remember an old advert in which a Lancastrian family was having an argument and their entire vocabulary was the word Potato.  "POTATO! POTATO-POTATOOO!"  That's pretty much what my brain shouts whenever I walk into the Baked Potato Shop.  It's definitely what my tummy's thinking. Hefty portions, perfectly cooked, fresh fillings piled on to bursting point... yes, yes, and yes.  (And by "hefty portions" I mean that I, self-professed Sultana Of Starch, can barely finish the tuberous exuberance they so whimsically refer to as Small.)  It's only a teeny shop, so if one of the staff is downstairs mixing up some more fillings you might find yourself queueing out in the cold; having only one server instead of two seems to make a disproportionate difference to the speed of the queue. But what a reward awaits the patient. Spud in abundance. Also, if you order the avocado salad from the vegetarian half of the menu (as I unerringly do), there are big lumps of cheese in it that you only notice when you eat it. And what's the best kind of cheese? Yes: SURPRISE cheese!  The other half of the menu is devoted to vegan food, and there are vegan homemade cakes on the counter and vegan box drinks in the fridge. It's great to see vegans so comprehensively catered for instead of being an afterthought on a sub-menu. But even for a dedicated beastie-biter like me, the meat-free delights of The Baked Potato Shop are a must on a trip down Cockburn Street. I'd wager that potatoes elsewhere in the city are just green with envy over these designer jackets.

YlUVfX-2nSdDcg6gryPLiQ.text: The baked potatoes are very nearly as perfect as can be. A real Edinburgh institution located at the top of Cockburn Street. A better choice than a franchise operation selling pizzas or burgers.

jUz7PEoUvk3QcbPwcffk-g.text: Baked Potatoes the size of my face and a huge selection of fillings that are all veggie or vegan and delicious. What more could you want?   They have a great selection of fillings that you didn't know that you wanted until you see, seriously avocado, cheddar cheese, onion and tomato is a genius combination. Although all the fillings are vegetarian there is such a huge range that meat eaters don't really notice and they are super yummy. The portion sizes are huge, I struggle to eat a 'small' potato and a medium would easily feed two people. Also they stock cans of Arizona Ice Tea which I love.   The staff are all super friendly and happy to give suggestions when you are being indecisive. There isn't much seating in the store but get take away and head to the Royal Mile to watch some street performers and you'll be more than happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A &#39;small&#39; potato.
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

moR_E_4J2M8lDiY5OObEhg.text: Hubby and I got a large with two fillings - overestimated our stomach capacities...couldn't finish!   We picked avocado salad and chili (thanks Yelpers!) and would recommend both.  Great price, another shop I would like to bring back with me.

jgIS1FBLdn7Gxe2QT-BXcg.text: I wanted to go there for nearly and year and finally my dream came True.. Well, I love potatoes and I loved their potatoes.. Small, medium or big.. I could eat anything and not complain..   I had a medium and got really full.. So I guess depending on the filling you can be full with a small or medium.. Now if you are a male.. Go for a big!!  I was very confused with all the available options and how they count as fillings.. But managed to get what I wanted.. (Mexican filling + cheddar = 2 fillings) cheddar rocks btw.. But next time I think I'll go for the vegetarian haggis..  Also, the prices are very reasonable for the outcome (really full belly)!!   Overall, good impression but I would like an easier and less complicated menu...

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tasty tattie!!!!!!!! (mexican + cheddar)

RBYFrzV_yQ36NBBqay8xHg.text: good: -inexpensive -(absurdly) large portion sizes -countless toppings  bad: -cash only  tip: -don't order a large unless you're planning to feed the rest of cockburn street -try their pastries. one of them tastes like a fancy twix.

3i3XPiEPlL5DEb4U-jORNQ.text: Awesome experience! Kind, fast service. Delicious food. Great vegan and vegetarian options. The only drawback would be seating area (very limited) but the food is easy to take away. We were able to sit down and eat, but we felt like we got lucky. Would love to return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Avocado Salad was fantastic!

Q9T2ld4qmNOp5hh-cgNAxQ.text: This place had so many options, it makes me sad that we were only in Edinburgh for such a limited time and that I couldn't try more of them. Before coming here I definitely didn't think of Scottish or British food as being synonymous with vegetarian friendly but after visiting this place I definitely had to reevaluate that.  I took a medium potato with sour cream and mushroom. I kind of figured that the mushrooms would be cooked so I was surprised to find that they were raw. While I think I might have preferred them to be cooked, with the sour cream they did go quite well. I also had garlic butter on my potato which was awesome! There are few comforts greater than a garlicky perfectly baked potato.  The place is tiny and only had one table, so we took our potatoes to eat at Princes Street Gardens about a block down.  While there are many reasons to return to Edinburgh, Baked Potato Shop might just be on the top of that list.

yg7zHfxJ5mVOMf534BALtw.text: Very good, very fast, very vegan friendly.  They were out of the first couple sides we asked for but the veggie samosas we got instead were great!

VtMwgwjVfHZjmYm2u58Mgw.text: VEGAN OPTIONS. The potatoes were absolutely covered in oil. Didn't even taste of potato. I got a small baked potato with corn on top and generally didn't like it. But, the other two people I was with got Mexican toppings and curried corn and they both enjoyed there's.... Extremely busy place, no place to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Potato with Mexican
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Medium potato with curried corn
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Small baked potato with corn topiing

DU1fV-Bw4svNfHh-NPzDzw.text: This is one of the greatest, creative twists on a simple dish ever. You can get three sizes of potato and all kinds of hot and cold sauces. It' a cute little place and there are not that many seats, but it's awesome to see the guys prepare these babies. Definitely worth it, and we will be returning next time we're in Edinburgh.

i9mkxJVqr98ScXTAeDUT2g.text: They use some seriously BIG potatoes so the "small" is enough to fill anyone. A "medium" is 1.5 potatoes and the large is 2 potatoes.  The fillings are great and a few you'd only find in Scotland,  just don't be tempted to add too many fillings like I did.  This place defines small. There's one table so plan on take out unless you have great timing.  The service was great and they load on the toppings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Small with chili, cheese, guacamole and sour cream.
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hole in the wall. One table.

aaoKD1UPifQnPRbuLdppRQ.text: Baked potatoes. Vegetarian. Cheese. Tons of toppings. Fairly priced. Heaven.   That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Guacamole and cheese for me, vegetarian baked beans and cheese for the other. SO GOOD

-pC2LtLU-6omMzh0-_moFA.text: Baked potato shop how I love thee! Please never stop selling your warm delicious fluffy on the inside crispy on the outside dreamboat potatoes.  We love your portion sizes, which are huge, like our hearts are for your delicious toppings. I especially keep retuning for your divine garlic butter, which melts oh so perfectly.  Yes your store is small, but it's friendly and cute as are all of your staff.  My hangovers love you and so do I.

an6WMYdOR3s0YQNE22_LTg.text: Pretty good potatoes! The vegan haggis was pretty gross though. I think the texture was very mushy and weird...... I mean I'm vegan to not eat animal products and the haggis really had the consistency of the guts of an animal. So I guess they did their job then with the haggis!   Other than that the potatoes are HUGE and so filling! Definitely will return but just not for the haggis :)

Jh-9XTYqEhKe0yyzyXc03A.text: Stopped here for a quick bite after just arriving to the city. And was not disappointed at all! Was very delicious and the portion size for the cost definitely worth it!

QGEtrHvDyl6HCIPQHpb-1g.text: I went here during a recent stay in Edinburgh, and I really hope I'll have the opportunity to go back. I realize it's just a baked potato shop, but it was so nice to have such a quick and simple fast food meal. Coming from the US where a fast meal = 1500+ calories of greasy death and digestive upset, it was refreshing to get an actual plant and have numerous vegetarian options for toppings.   The shop was relatively crowded when I went, but the staff was friendly and patient with everyone (while still keeping things moving along nicely). Prices were reasonable, and though there was no seating, it was easy to find a place outside to eat and enjoy the sounds of a random guy with his bagpipe. After my visit here, I find I've gotten a lot more creative with my baked potatoes. I can't wait to get back to Edinburgh next summer.

48Yl74QdBKEHm75yxt_AZg.text: Love this place! Come here all the time for a small or medium potato.. Even the small is huge! I like to alternate toppings but the garlic butter is always a must  small shop with just a table that sits about 5 but doesn't detract from the awesomeness of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Medium baked potato with garlic butter, cheese &amp; corn

SyecSV1uHCxb5n66XlS8lw.text: Baked potato with haggis and cheese was delicious. Many vegan options for some of my family. Small potato was huge and too much to finish. Don't bother ordering a large. Everyone in our group ordered a different size and they all looked relative.  As a former restaurant manager, this was my lasting impression: Young employee was sitting outside door smoking when we entered. She came in to help, removed her sweater, replaced her apron, and NEVER washed her hands (or even put on gloves) before handling our food. I wasn't the only one who noticed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis potato with cheese

PkszzIrM-8vDs0WvsP_Tcg.text: Really good baked potato in this place , you can choose between a lot of filling and different size of potato (the little one is already quite big )... There is only one table and it s very crowned sometimes but it s really good so y have to go :)

JI6gZOKcMy7SFTk7fxzsxg.text: I came all the way to edinburg from canada to eat a baked potato and i was not disappointed!! i often think about this place and how badly i want to go back. the sausage rolls are also delicious!

UEDNCpGOQUh7MdZPzHHADQ.text: Friend was visiting and I declared we had to have a baked potato since it is the British way. We grabbed a small potato with chili (vegan, the only option) and cheese, and a diet Irn Bru on the side. One small table means most potatoes are eaten out of doors. It was delicious and I will certainly be back to satisfy my once a week jacket potato craving. Oh and a small was more than enough for me!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Small with chili and Irn Bru

h0PPF7Fsw5LphTpBHyWuuA.text: Delicious vegan food! I am so glad I went here for lunch. So many plant based options and keeping me carbed up on these long hot vacation days. If I ever get the chance to come back I will be stopping here for sure.

8ktuAi15_42xchVe7YoEGA.text: Not a bad place if you're shopping the Royal Mile and you want something different for lunch, this isn't a bad option.  Only two sizes here. The Large is one giant potato, the XX Large is two giant potatoes. I love sour cream and was very pleased to see heaping spoonsful placed on my potatoes. In fact, it's probably the only restaurant in the world where I've actually received a satisfactory amount of sour cream! The cheddar cheese and hummus also came in epic proportions!  The menu offers 28 toppings, some pretty innovative, and even my picky son found something he liked. It's not a bad stop for the family. You can even get haggis if you want to truly have the Scottish experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. XX Large potato loaded with hummus!
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu as of June of 2019.
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior of The Baked Potato Shop.

pOVL6IdLsWnogbYTkd3Vkw.text: the Baked Potato Shop is located in old town very close to Edinburgh Castle making it a very convenient stop for an expected comfort meal after having visited the castle. this happened to be our order of operations.  though i can't say we were totally disappointed by our visit, we expected more flavor, period. we started out by sharing a haggis samosa which we both decided should not be a thing. the concept of a vegan haggis was intriguing, so we went for it, but the clashing of cultures in the pastry did not work and the haggis was lacking in character. i've never had a traditional haggis, so i'm not sure how to compare it to what we had, but if that's what haggis is supposed to taste like, why bother? my boyfriend and i each got a large potato with three fillings. from what i remember, mine included the spinach salad, hummus, and baked beans. my partner got the vegetable curry, hummus, and spinach salad. the man behind the counter was great at making suggestions, though in retrospect mixing the hot and cold toppings was probably not a wise choice. the temperatures fought each other resulting in a luke warm glop of topping over a steaming hot potato. there were no complaints about the size of the meals, because the potatoes themselves were huge! that having been said, either more of each topping was needed or the salt and/or herb and spice factors should've been amped up. i added quite a bit of salt to mine to make it palatable. the Baked Potato Shop is intended to be a grab and go place, but they offer a small seating area which consists of a somewhat large wooden dining table surrounded by benches resulting in the sharing of food and space by different parties of people. this aspect of the shop i liked. it gave a good opportunity to share space with locals and visitors alike.  a solid positive about the eatery is the wide variety of plant based options on the menu, including potato fillings, snacks, and desserts! the prices were right and the atmosphere was comfortable. if i were judging The Baked Potato Shop purely on the food, i definitely would've knocked it down a star, but the service was good enough, the comfort level of the place was good enough and the menu offerings (lack of taste, outstanding) pumped it up a star. the concept of the eatery is unique, so decide for yourself if it's worth a visit.

Yz3IkhRdEwdtQd9vMQ7RyA.text: I LOOOOVE potatoes. Especially baked potatoes. So how excited was I when I realized that there is literally a baked potato shop in Edinburgh? Very. That is, until I actually got my food.   Got inside and ordered a 6 "large" potato with just sour cream. What I got could only be described as a swamp of clumpy sour cream hiding a mediocre potato. I mean, look at the picture. What. The. Heck. Is. That.   I wanted to try the potato underneath, so after some excavation, I bit into a mushy, bland mess. Tossed the entire container in the trash.   This place disgraces the name potato.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sour Cream swamp

iX-ZcsOCgkukAcZTjENekQ.text: The potato itself is cooked well, nice and crispy.  Some of the topping options were just odd (avocado with chunks of cheese in it?!) Extremely quick service.

R1G3o5vPcX1RqiK4nFSNUg.text: This place was recommended by some online list of "must see places in Edinburgh!" and it was a total let down. It was mostly just a soggy old potato with about 3 cups of sour cream and 4 cups of cheese on it. Yuk. I couldn't even finish it. My advice is to put a little love into this. Add ingredients that taste good. Put thought into the recipes. It could be sooo good! Bleh. How about some pesto aioli? Or, fresh roasted Mediterranean vegetables? How about a Greek potato with sundried tomatoes, feta, olives and spnach with an italian dressing? How about a Mexican Potato with chipotle sauce, corn, beans etc?

NfjBJYuiZBf5pq2j6FxAVg.text: I love this place. The food is Delicious and they make the only good guacamole in the whole country.  Unfortunately they have recently reduced the size of their portions by a significant margin and raised the prices.    It is no longer worth visiting, sadly.

nkGOsULn8r-4Li_5d5Sn_w.text: If your in the mood for a baked potato at a reasonable price, this place is meant for you!  Located just off the Royal Mile down a tiny little street that will take you to Newtown if you keep walking down.    We selected 2 medium potatoes with 2 toppings each.  Both the husband and I LOVE food and can eat...our medium potatoes were so big we could only finish half each.    Mind you this is a vegetarian baked potato shop so you won't find any meat products.  We are not vegetarians either so don't let that sway you. You can survive one meal sans meat!!  They ask if you'd like butter or garlic butter and then actually work it into the potato.  They don't just drop the toppings on top and let you do the work.  We were pleasantly surprised.  I had the chili and avocado salad.  Both were great.  The chili was perfectly spicy.  The avocado salad was awesome!  It had gigantic hunks of cheese and tomato mixed with some red onion.    They have one small table that would seat 4.  We took our potatoes back to our hotel and enjoyed from our room while watching TV:-). If the weather is nice, grab your tattie and stroll to the park.  The potatoes are so hot even 30 minutes after we got ours.  Would be nice if they offered "traditional" broccoli and cheese but hey...who's tradition is that anyway?  I'm giving this place 4 stars simply because they don't offer any real meat chooses.  With that aside, the food is great and the meat wasn't really that big a deal.

s4sGwxgHA8PIjsF8tkgf2g.text: I feel bad giving a poor review, but this was just not good. We ordered two jackets with chili, and it tasted like spicy veggies in ketchup. The potato was mushy, and not in a good way - I didn't know it was possible for potatoes to be poorly cooked.  I wish we'd tried something other than the chili - but I am guessing they'd have tasted similarly awful on such a terrible potato.

ZO92AraUS5DgPb3r_6a4SA.text: Oh the things to say about this place. We went with the expectation that this potato was going to be best we ever had. Well- it was not. I mean.... I KNOW I can make a better baked potato at home, but it wasn't just that.. it was the fact that we got two potatoes but when we asked for a separate container to put the other potato, since we were sharing, we were told that it would be the cost of another potato. What? It was also that there was one table in there. Just one. So I guess it's a takeaway place.. but as a tourist, eating a potato outside in the rain is just not appealing. We waited like 20 minutes for a couple to get up after their potato and then sat next to a random girl who stayed while finishing hers. They were out of guac the day we went, could not taste any butter, had to add salt on top, and then there was just potato left with no toppings. Also the girl was very flaky and you had to repeat things a few times for her to understand.. We were all very disappointed and do not recommend and will not return.

MgttrEqGnqOS0if3EWl5Gw.text: What an amazing idea for a food place. A friend told me about this place from her visit to Edinburgh and was raving about it so I just had to check it out. It's right off the Royal Mile. The staff working were all very helpful, fun, and witty. It was most definitely the best baked potato I've ever had and I've been thinking about them ever since!! If you are walking the Royal Mile I highly recommend stopping in for a baked potato. Their toppings are fantastic and there are tons of vegan and vegetarian options too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baked potato with baked beans and sour cream, so delicious!

bB0n5d6Qrrckrye2j8SCyw.text: Heard about this place especially from the vegetarian community as a must-go in Edinburgh. I stopped here for dinner to-go on a cold night and was not disappointed. I got a small baked potato (which was huge!) with baked beans and cheddar cheese. Even after taking it home in a ten-minute walk it was still hot and the cheese was wonderfully melted. A little pricey but worth it for a treat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baked beans and cheddar cheese &#34;small&#34; potato
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The oustide of the shop

ly7hgScoHCGuzgfG9CFdSw.text: Vegan approved. This little restaurant is an entirely vegetarian operation, with tons of delicious items to add on top of the ginormous potatoes you can order. I was a bit taken aback by how many vegan items there were to choose from. The gent behind the counter was super patient and helpful as I considered pretty much every combination before finally deciding. I got the chili and spinach salad together on a small potato and it was awesome.   This is a small joint, not a lot of seating inside (if any at all). Will stop by next time I'm in town -- I think this place will become a staple lunch venue for my Edinburgh journeys.

eOv7ZPZR-utCxeyrcPpMxw.text: Come early so you don't miss out on the amazing toppings.   I came here with a few of my coworkers because they were absolutely RAVING about this baked potato that they had on previous trips here. Well, I love potatoes... so initially I was very freaking excited. And oh my... this place did not disappoint.   Right when you walk in, you can feel the heat of the ovens hit your body. The shop itself is very small. Only has one table that sits about five.   Unfortunately, we arrived a little later in the day, so a lot of the toppings we wanted were all out. So all of us settled with a baked potato (you can choose small, medium, or large) with garlic butter (absolute heaven), salt and pepper, and cheese. And oh my. Sounds plain and boring right? No! Not right!   This baked potato (after a minute or two of mixing so my cheese completely melted) is by far one of the best things I have ever eaten. Holy moly. It was freaking delicious. And very fulfilling.   I love how quaint the shop is. And the best part is they cater to vegans and vegetarians. Big plus in my book! They even recycle. Yay!   My mouth is watering just thinking of this potato I had. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

xw8OxGQxw3-fxvGvogUD4A.text: Solid food, and a great deal. The name is pretty self explanatory- it's a baked potato with a topping of choice. In expensive Edinburgh, this is a good choice on a budget, as you get a pretty large portion. There's really nowhere to sit inside though, so best to take the food out for a picnic or something like that.

XHMjdyIYunkqoWxkVmTySQ.text: Definitely an Edinburgh staple. I'm not really that big a fan of jacket potatoes to begin with, but on top of that I thought the toppings were a little bland, even the seasoned veggies and salads. Service was fast and friendly enough.

bdliqDijuCJn8YCjyY4ljQ.text: Great food! I'm no vegetarian, but the "chili", cheese , sour cream potato was the bomb!

ZJw2THPD9N7okrneQnSyZA.text: This place does exactly what it says on the tin...sells yummy baked potatoes!   Located just off The Royal Mile, this is a popular spot for tourists and potato enthusiasts alike. I've never seen such an extensive potato filling menu, with all the classics and plenty of vegan friendly options. I also never thought I'd get so excited about said potato filling menu but there you go!   We went for the medium size and these were honestly ginormous, I can't even imagine what the large ones are like. I opted for the classic cheese and coleslaw combo with butter and it hit all the right spots.   There's only one small table here which we were lucky to get so you wouldn't be coming here with a large group for lunch but this didn't stop the constant flow of people from coming and getting their food to take away. Clearly a popular spot and I can see why!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

NFRROBNkmbBvf1uTdh6wZw.text: We stopped in here to grab a potato to go.  Their hours on the website said closed at 5 or 6, but since is was the festival month of August, we decided to stop by to see if they stayed open late this month.  Our luck, they did!  We stood in a decent line to get our potatoes.   I was bummed that they were out of the avocado one, but switched to just a medium cheddar cheese and garlic butter that I shared with my 8 year old.  That was plenty for both of us.  My two teenagers each got their own small and did the deal for purchasing .  The potato was so creamy, almost like creamed potatoes inside a baked potato.  We all enjoyed it and I highly recommend.  Very conveniently located and cost us about 16 pounds for 4 people, which included 2 small potatoes, 1 medium potato, and 2 drinks.  One of the better priced meals we had in Edinburgh.

EvU6oVtwT8hwhsUkdyf17Q.text: Got the small baked potato combo with 1 stuffing and a drink for $5. The potato was hot and a generous serving of the haggis. I kinda liked the potato by itself with garlic butter though. :D good service. Only 1 table inside so I sat outside by the window to eat my potato and advertised for the restaurant. Haha

q-EPI1UKwB5m8_6LrWXAxQ.text: We had the beans and cheese potato and the chili potato.  Both were deeply satisfying, filling, and yummy.  Afterewards, I just wanted to take a nap.  I would like to try some of the other toppings there, too, such as the avocado salad and the soured cream.  Service was good, but it was very crowded, and the noise level from the radio made it hard to understand what was being said.  There's no room to eat in there, so we took our food, walked up the street a few yards and put it on one of those black boxes and ate.  There is a circus-like atmosphere during the Fringe Festival--a massive crush of people walking the narrow streets, loud talking and boisterous laughing, pretty girls walking by in soft wool sweaters, people singing the blues, bagpipes playing, a girl with a unicycle, men dressed as women---but none of that existed.  IT WAS JUST ME AND THE POTATO.  I was lost in my own world.  Transported.  I washed it all down with a extra-large IRN-BRU, a Scottish soda pop that tastes like a cross between an orange soda and a cream soda.  For afters we bought a slice of Tiffin cake and a slice of ginger-lemon cake.  The Tiffin is quite good--it has a chocolate topping with coconut   The ginger-lemon cake tasted suspiciously like a banana-date cake, like an old-fashioned tea loaf recipe that grandma used to make, so I think we got the wrong cake, but it was tasty.  We got all of this great food for around 12 pounds--a bargain.  I thoroughly enjoyed this meal, but I can't help but think that a wedding of soured cream and bacon would be the supreme match of flavors with a potato.  Sadly, this isn't likely to happen at a vegetarian establishment.  Give me a meat option and I'll give you 5 stars.  It's only a matter of time before they discover a method of inserting a Snicker's Bar in it and deep frying it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A chile potato after I murdered it and an Irn-Bru.  Yum!  Tiffin cake looks on in terror.

wFjClpahOPs0zQw68w11Og.text: The baked potato shop kept me alive during a number of Edinburgh festivals where eating and sleeping are always a low priority. The potatoes are seriously huge. Sadly so are the queues and it's often too cold to sit outside so the lack of seating is a bit of a pain. But their veggie chilli and veggie haggis potatoes are delicious. They spicy hummous is great too.

vazV4yCE1B8tGF4N3Q1DKg.text: Stumbled on this place during a weekend at the Fringe festival when we wanted to grab something quickly and noticed a queue coming out of this place - always a good sign.   All toppings (there are hot and cold options) are vegetarian, think I got a veggie chilli, cheese and coleslaw and it was DELICIOUS! Portions were huge and this was the nicest jacket potato I've ever had and all of the group agreed.   Think the did other things like wraps or sandwiches but really the potatoes stole the show!

9EObD2GDC8IuzlYZ5k1xIw.text: Thought I'd left my baked tattie days behind me once I graduated but this is a great place if you can eat on the hoof or find a place to sit. How anyone can get through the largest size is beyond me but the medium did me just fine. If you're fed up with a 'baked potato' straight from a microwave then reacquaint yourself with how they should be here.

hINBCj9GYIs3t7euqHVmYQ.text: The vegetarian haggis samosa was extraordinary. The avocado salad (avocado, tomato,+ cheese) baked potato was massive and amazing.

_tzKM4fVSuJFWfbp_oeddw.text: As someone visiting from far away, the Baked Potato Shop is a MUST when I am in Edinburgh.  Lots of personality, HUGE potatoes, and lots and lots and lots of great toppings.  They are also vegetarian and vegan conscious, for you folks out there.  We were lucky enough to stumble across this place our first time in town, and it's now a tradition.  Try the mushroom & sour cream topping, or the veggie chili.

0FKFnT8CyA0Pb-fgpwWioA.text: Yum!  The enticing aroma and cozy location will draw you into the Baked Potato Shop! The toppings are fun and they are no joke bout adding butter to each spud!!  I order the medium thinking it was a for a medium sized potato but i was served two medium sized spuds!  And with topping of cheese and pineapples pre-supper snack became dinner.  It was good though, very tasty and delish!!

mpj_VW0pkDbDC0ke3exPuw.text: This tiny yet awesome tattie shop has an amazing selection of vegetarian and vegan fillings.   Just don't count on eating in the shop - there's only one table.   Tasty. I like the spicy houmous potato.

xrrzLWxzgvWu-iegHwv-bQ.text: the baked potatoes here are some of the biggest i have ever seen!!!! you can get loads of fillings and its really difficult to eat the whole thing!! but i always manage it..

d5fTfInu9KGMiRVzn2sV-g.text: great value, filling, perfect to warm you up on a chilly day.  a medium potato is enough for two meals.  staff incredibly nice.  good solid food with fresh ingredients.    try the onion, pineapple and cheese filling.  sounds disgusting, but sweet and savory.    the line can get stupid long during festival, but as long as the people ahead of you are ordering instead of performing or mugging, it moves fast.

xkoVqTQ0KRvtpkAlFXFlWA.text: I love this little Old Town gem. It's a great place to have a cheap lunch - excellent place for vegetarians, vegans and people that don't mind going without meat this once.   The choices of potato fillings are creative and endless, with both hot and even more cold options. My favourite is the (cold) cheese, onion and pineapple stuffing! For 3.75 that's one of the cheapest lunches I can have in the city without cooking myself. My partner's favourite is the (warm) vegie curry.   The staff is very friendly and efficient - you don't have to wait long even if there is a line. You may choose to eat in but I never do. I either take it home or, if weather permits, take it to Princes St Gardens for a lovely picnic.

RHSDwGjyEwy27BvOJtOd6A.text: This place is a must!!! If you are visiting Edinburgh this place is an absolute must!!! Ill never look at a baked potato the same way! I ordered a medium and I couldnt even finish that one!! My toppings were: lots of cheese and avaocados!!! oh my I think this place has changed me!! have fun with your potato!! The lines out the door but its worth the wait!!

5O6D7-Jdb8OvN_D76Qwucg.text: American tourist yelping.  Tried the tattie with curry - it was nice.    I tried their millionaire shortbread.. amazing.  It's like Reeses Pieces cup with caramel.  And it's only 60 pence!  And I tried their Tiffin, the guy working there recommended it.  He described it as like "christmas pudding - almost."  And he was accurate.  I was introduced a few days ago to Christmas pudding.. and fell in love!  Got all this fruit cake flavor soaked in rum.    Anyway, came back today, and picked up more tiffins and more shortbreads to take with me back home.

cMFC3D1yjPs6a36XJBNcbw.text: A truly fantastic takeaway. If you need to grab some lunch, you'll find something hearty, healthy and filling in this place. I'm particularly impressed with their vegetarian options- not just the usual egg mayo! Hurrah!

DaKcpxiWJjlELZobxXNHJw.text: On a trip featuring 50 degree weather during the second week of July, the last place I thought I would want to eat would be at the Baked Potato Shop. Since I usually hate baked potatoes, it kind of made the whole situation worse. However, when I tried my custom-made baked potato for the first time I was totally in love. I'm not sure if we have any operating restaurant like this in the United States, but we should if we don't! I never thought I would say this, but it was potato-ey, buttery, cheesy perfection.

t18CPNKgwjeQbVofI1jVTA.text: Quick and cheap, but food isn't the best, really. Very small space makes it difficult sometimes, and customers are forced to take their food outside. But if you are looking for an alternative fast food company, it can work.

yZ0HrPDYfG5mCyjFVhZLsw.text: Very friendly Hippy staff and yummy big portions. Its nice to find somewhere with such a big vegan selection. Only reason I took a star off because there is just the small space to sit in and eat. Somewhere this tasty should have more space as if i could have stayed in the shop i would have been having second helpings. Also nice mix of vegan cakes etc

2jYKq79ssG_tCiOLySZQgA.text: It matters little that there's limited seating in this little gem of a food stop, the Royal Mile sits on it's doorstep so make your baked potato filling selection (tough decision  all so yummy) and get strolling along the cobbled streets of Edinburgh feasting your eyes as well as your belly. Deliciously wholesome at a pleasingly tasty price.

tDFHyvnwTq8mtc262T_eEw.text: Phwar, what a carbohydrate feast. Weighing the same as a small boulder, these potatoes can be filled with absolutely anything, and the guys in the shop wont go lightly on the dollops. Avacado, chilli, tuna, cheese, beans; just oogle at the board and come up with your dream combination. Make sure they charge you correctly, though.

iip1G1UspisWGq9yGpdF9w.text: yummy potato with vegan haggis, tiny dining area though

ubjgMch7fGLJNW60M2xilg.text: Yep, pretty much what everone else has said. I've been a lover of the Baked Potato Shop since I used to work in Flip clothes shop in 2000. The food is absolutely gorgeous and the helpings huge.   If I had one little insider tip for you I'd say when they ask if you want butter, ask for their garlic butter. It may scare the vampires off but it also adds great flavour to any tattie.   Enjoy!

cR4Juyb9YBBd9i24gNjkJA.text: This review will be small, much like the Baked Potato Shop.  Though small in size, this predominantly take-away restaurant offers a fast and healthy alternative to fish & chips, doner/kebab or deep-fried anything. Not only is a baked potato incredibly nutritious and good for you (don't forget to eat the skin, people!!) the BPS offers a range of scrumptious vegetarian toppings of all sorts to don your tattie. Avocado, red pepper and cheese; cous cous, beans and peppers; curry rice; hummus; pineapple; coleslaw... the list goes on!  With small, medium and large potatoes to choose from, they make a tasty treat for yourself or to share. Though there is very, very limited seating in the place (a small square table with a bench) I've always managed to snag a spot and have actually met some pretty interesting people and had some great conversations over our baked potatoes. A  British/Korean couple from Australia, a homeless lady, and a mother, son and daughter from Spain who I gave bar recommendations to. I suppose it's those experiences which have contributed to my likeness for the Baked Potato Shop.  If the cramped quarters don't suit you, then get your potato for take away and go for a stroll along the Royal Mile, or head down Cockburn St. to Princes St. Gardens, grab a bench, and watch all the gothy-punk teenagers flirt with each other.  The staff are a bit hippy-ish but are friendly and helpful (ask for a sample if you're curious about a certain topping!) and always play obscure music. The BPS also offers veggie/vegan samosas and haggis (be aware those with nut allergies), and a few vegan dessert treats as well. There's a fridge stocked with all sorts of pop and sparkling juice too.   Overall, the Baked Potato Shop offers a tasty and enjoyable potato eating experience!

tTiSTMtzg_hNE91gqmly3A.text: So so so so delicious. I had a curried one with all sorts of veggies, which they recommended to me because I couldn't choose. Even the mushrooms (which I despise!) tasted delicious. And through a long, disgusting walk in the rain (what a surprise!) my potato was still warm to eat. If I'm ever back in Edinburgh (hopefully soon) I will be sure to stop in. Your wallet and stomach will be incredibly satisfied.  Just as a note, this is take-out. There is one small table but your chances of getting it are tiny. Find yourself a warm spot (good luck) somewhere else to eat this deliciousness.

q-9J5Nvuh2qH8wT406-WmQ.text: A good-valued eat certainly.  My wife and I split one potato with 2-toppings.  It wasn't extraordinary, but it did do the job and put a dent in our hunger.  There's only 1 table to eat at - pretty much no space at all.  Recommend splitting a meal if you can.

IJ-wuj-TZ6Y47WN3b8hQsg.text: From outside, I couldn't believe this was thee Baked Potato Shop that 14 people were raving about on Yelp! It doesn't look very flashy, and it's small with zero seating but as soon as I shoved a plastic forkful of potato in my gub I realised what all the fuss was about.  These potatoes are really lovely, much better than I have ever made for myself and I would love to know their secret! The skin is very crispy, and although I don't usually eat the skin I dug right into this one. My cheddar cheese had just about completely melted by now and I sat on a bench scranning it, lovely.  I have to say I didn't think it was that expensive for the popularity of the place coupled with the location. The tatties were about 3-ish depending on what size and what you have. My lunch came to around 4.50 with a juice.   I can only add to the recommendations of others, that you should go and try this place at least once whilst visiting Edinburgh for a hot and tasty lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

D42XsJFKSkeTIp20tA7VWw.text: Very tasty, BIIIIG potatoes. We went there because it seemed very busy, so we thought it must be good! The potatoes are very good - huuuge and with lots of interesting fillings. I had cheese and spinach, my partner had egg mayo and spinach.  Only problem is the staff are incredibly slow and (when we went any way) have incredibly LOUD music on, which was very annoying when combined with slow service.  Tasty tatos, though.

xVbjcW-5Li2yjGDyZgH6cA.text: I haven't been to this place in years, but the two or three times I visited Edinburgh, I made a beeline for the Baked Potato Shop. It's cheap, you get a lot of food--the potatoes are as big as your head--and it's very filling and satisfying. Ideal cold-weather food.   Baked Potato Shop is also very vegetarian and vegan-friendly, like a lot of places in Scotland. And how else can a vegetarian try haggis? They have a veggie haggis potato topping! Now I want to go back, although I'm good on the veg haggis.

NV0PnTMJe33cFThWP_hYHg.text: I only discovered this place thanks to Yelp and man, am I glad to have discovered it!  It's a takeaway (there is one table for four in the front but good luck getting it) so we had to eat our baked potato goodness on the pavement out front, leaning on the shop's windowsill.  It was a bit intimidating/confusing upon entering and when I asked what a cheese and bean was I got a bit of attitude (perhaps deservedly?) and also when I asked what a small was, but the potato made everything okay and I'll go back often.  A small is two small-sized baked potatoes and a medium is three midsized baked potatoes.  We each had the cheese and veggie chili and both of us thought it was amazing, with lots of chunks of veg.  The two orders were less than 8 (no drinks).  This place was heaven on a cold day and made our insides nice and warm.  A great alternative to soup or chili by itself.

sAiL-27xvAExjfHn3QPtug.text: If you're looking a very simple but delicious meal try this.   The wide selection of choices can leave you confused and dawdling as you pick exactly what you'd like. For instance, having decided you fancy curry in your spud there are then about 5 options you could take from there.   Be sure to take your time as you eat at the solitary table as hurrying along ruins the experience. Fellow tatty lovers join you as you dine, imparting their philosophy on what should and shouldn't fill a potato. Gig and exhibition posters dress the room and give an alternative air to proceedings.   The staff are friendly and knowlegeable, often throwing in suggestions on what to try next. The glaringly tasteless tip cup is rarely less than full as a result.

photos.caption: Photo of The Baked Potato Shop - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Baked Potato Shop

pfqq8J3G55ZxZf-DgCpmxA.text: Q: "What do you say  to an angry 300 lb potato?" A: "Nothing.  You just butter him up."  300 pounds of baked potato would provide days of culinary heaven.  Second best?  A dolled up potato from the Baked Potato Shop.   Simple.  Vegetarian. Varied.  Savory.  Filling.  Perfect.

a69cd5IOm3P9ot4Q_mXdFQ.text: The Baked Potato Shop is amazing! The vegetarian haggis potato was a wonderful find for a cold, rainy afternoon.  Lots of great vegan hand held snacks and desserts too. Amazing little place.

stHlTt5onFpj6s2mldO8_w.text: Really really bland food with almost no flavor. I tried my friends' dishes as well but still very bland.

UkTIp1DtOFe-_8tN0esF0g.text: We were looking for a place to have breakfast and this shop looked nice and cozy so we thought of giving it a try. In one line I can tell you that even months after that we keep raing about this place!! It's totally awesome!
